introduction.p: To reduce an algebraic fraction, we must factor its numerator and denominator.

li.p: We factor out a common factor of 4x to get 4x(x-1).
This is a difference of two squares that factors as (2x-1)(2x+1).
This is the square of a binomial, (2x-1)^2.
We first factor out 3 to find 3(9a^2-1), then factor the difference of two squares to get 3(3a-1)(3a+1).
This is a differece of two cubes, which factors as (3a-1)(9a^2+3a+1).
We first factor out a to get a(81a^2-1), then factor the difference of two squares to get a(9a-1)(9a+1) .

subsection.title: 2. Find the opposite of a binomial

introduction.p: To find the opposite or negative of a binomial we multiply by -1.

statement.p:
Which of these is the opposite of m^2-p~?
m^2+p
m-p^2
p-m^2

solution.p: The opposite of m^2-p is -(m^2-p) = -m^2+p, or p-m^2.

statement.p:
Which of these pairs of binomials are opposites?
3c-5 and 5+3c
5-3c and 53-5c
5c-3 and 3-5c

solution.p: The opposite of 5c-3 is -(5c-3)=-5c+3, or 3-5c, so (c) is correct.
